column4: TREASURIES-Prices rise after disappointing U.S. corporate reports
column5: NEW YORK  July 22 Benchmark and long-dated Treasury yields hit their lowest levels in nearly two weeks on Wednesday after another round of disappointing U.S. corporate reports drove safe-haven buying  while uncertainty ahead of next week's Federal Reserve meeting capped gains.

column4: UPDATE 2-Intel's US$7bn four-parter gets US$20bn in demand
column5: (Rewrites throughout  adds more details)     By Paul Kilby and Natalie Harrison     NEW YORK  July 22 (IFR) - Intel is on track to price a US$7bn bond on Wednesday to help finance its acquisition of chipmaker Altera after attracting more than US$20bn in investor demand.     The deal  split across four tranches ranging in maturities from five to 30 years  had been long-expected by market participants. column4: $5.7 billion wiped off European tech shares after Apple outlook disappoints
column5: LONDON Top European technology stocks shed nearly $6 billion of market value on Wednesday  with suppliers for Apple the top fallers after the tech giant's revenue forecasts fell short of expectations.

column4: Qualcomm slashes jobs and costs  says may split itself up
column5: Chipmaker Qualcomm Inc  said it may break itself up as it delivered its third profit warning this year and announced plans to slash jobs and spending in the face of rising competition. | Video

column5: July 22 Chipmaker Qualcomm Inc said it may break itself up as it delivered its third profit warning this year and announced plans to slash jobs and spending.
July 22 Chipmaker Qualcomm Inc said on Wednesday that it would conduct a strategic review that may result in the company being broken up.
